title: MS DNS question.
content: Can you run dcdiag /v /c /e /q Also if you put the output in the code box it makes it waaaay easier to read. Thanks
contentWithMarkup:
So I have 3 domain controllers, all Server 2012. DNS runs on all 3 and seemingly is setup correctly.

I know there's know more PDC's and BDCs, but I'm going to refer to them that way just to separate out the different devices.

So when my primary goes offline, no one can login to the domain. DNS services on the BDC's do not respond, even if I reboot a client or do ipconfig /flushdns and try again. I ran dcdiag /c /v and got some failures. I was hoping someone smarter than I could help me decipher. I'm masked off private entries, but DC1, DC2 and DC3 should be apparent throughout:

Directory Server Diagnosis

Performing initial setup:
Trying to find home server...
* Verifying that the local machine XXXXX-DC2, is a Directory Server.
Home Server = XXXXX-DC2
* Connecting to directory service on server XXXXX-DC2.
* Identified AD Forest.
Collecting...
